Name: MPI_MODE_SEQUENTIAL
Description:
MPI_MODE_SEQUENTIAL is a flag that can be passed to MPI_File_open to specify that the file will be accessed sequentially. The MPI implementation can leverage this information to apply access optimisations on certain sequential devices. MPI_MODE_SEQUENTIAL cannot be used in conjunction with MPI_MODE_RDWR.
Other tags are: MPI_MODE_RDONLY, MPI_MODE_RDWR, MPI_MODE_WRONLY, MPI_MODE_CREATE, MPI_MODE_EXCL, MPI_MODE_DELETE_ON_CLOSE, MPI_MODE_UNIQUE_OPEN and MPI_MODE_APPEND.
